snippet: The leader of an opposition party, Vladimir Kozlov, was sentenced to seven and a half years in prison on Monday after he was convicted of trying to overthrow the government.
abstract: Vladimir Kozlov, leader of an opposition party in Kazakhstan, is sentenced to seven and a half years in prison after he is convicted of trying to overthrow government; he denies charges.
lead_paragraph: The leader of an opposition party, Vladimir Kozlov, was sentenced to seven and a half years in prison on Monday after he was convicted of trying to overthrow the government.

headline.main: Kazakhstan: Leader of an Opposition Party Is Jailed
headline.print_headline: Kazakhstan: Leader of an Opposition Party Is Jailed
